intro: Stelis crescentiicola, commonly known as the crescent-leaf stelis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Malaysia. The plant has slender, wiry stems that often hang from trees, and its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette. It produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, typically during the rainy season. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species in the wild.
